monster.name: Flesh Mound
languages: understands Common but can't speak it

trait.name: Heavy Sleeper
entries: If either of the mound’s forms has been unconscious within the past minute, it can’t use its {@atk mw slam} attack more than once per turn.

trait.name: Oozing Body
entries: The flesh mound can move through the space of another creature and through any opening large enough for a Medium creature. It can't end its turn inside another creature’s space and provokes opportunity attacks normally.

trait.name: Instinctual Defense
entries: When the mound drops to 0 hit points, each creature it currently has engulfed is expelled prone in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of it. The mound’s statistics are then replaced by those of its second form, {@creature Walter, the Graveborn|CoS-Reloaded}. Its initiative count doesn’t change, and excess damage doesn’t carry over, though it keeps any conditions it had.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The flesh mound makes two attacks, and can replace one of them with Engulf. If its Heavy Sleeper feature is active, it can’t use its slam more than once and can’t use Engulf on the same turn it uses slam.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, or 10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) if Heavy Sleeper is active. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}).

action.name: Bone Splinters
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +5} to hit, range 20/60 ft., up to two targets within 5 ft. of each other. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Engulf
entries: The flesh mound attempts to engulf one Medium or smaller creature it is grappling. The target must make a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw. On a failure, it is blinded, restrained, and unable to breathe, and must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution save at the start of each of its turns or take 8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. An engulfed creature can repeat the Strength save at the end of each of its turns, escaping on a success.

bonus.name: Rupture
entries: The mound expels a pustule at a point within 20 ft. Each creature within 5 ft. of that point must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of the mound’s next turn.

bonus.name: Quake
entries: The mound slams the ground. Each creature within 10 ft. must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or fall {@condition prone}.

reaction.name: Multiple Reactions
entries: The flesh mound can take up to three reactions per round, but no more than one per turn. If it would lose its reactions and isn’t {@condition incapacitated}, it instead loses one reaction.

reaction.name: Squelch
entries: When it takes melee damage, the mound attempts to grapple the attacker with Slam.

reaction.name: Roll
entries: When it takes ranged damage or a harmful spell, the mound moves up to its speed directly toward or away from the attacker (no opportunity attacks). If it moves toward the attacker, it may then attempt to shove them.

monster.name: Walter, the Graveborn
languages: understands Common but can't speak it

trait.name: Heavy Sleeper
entries: If either of the mound’s forms has been unconscious within the past minute, it can’t use its {@atk mw tentacle} attack more than once per turn.

trait.name: Oozing Body
entries: The flesh mound can move through the space of another creature and through any opening large enough for a Medium creature. It can't end its turn inside another creature’s space and provokes opportunity attacks normally.

trait.name: Innocent Heart
entries: The mound’s center conceals its heart: the infant corpse of Walter Durst encased in a rib cage (AC 15, same ability scores as the mound). Whenever Walter’s corpse takes damage, the mound takes twice that amount.

trait.name: Mother’s Lullaby
entries: A creature that uses its action to hum or play Waltz for Klara and succeeds on a {@dc 10} Charisma (Performance) check causes the mound to expose its heart; until the start of that creature’s next turn, the mound can’t use its Withdraw reaction.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mound makes three attacks, or two if Heavy Sleeper is active.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) if Heavy Sleeper is active. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 15 ft. toward the mound.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Gore Spray
entries: The mound spews gore in a 15‑foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage and becoming {@condition blinded} until the end of the mound’s next turn on a failure, or half damage and no blindness on a success. Using this bonus action exposes the mound’s heart.

bonus.name: Wail
entries: Walter’s corpse emits a shriek. Each creature that can hear it within 30 ft. must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or take 2 ({@damage 1d4}) psychic damage and be {@condition deafened} until the end of the mound’s next turn. Using this bonus action exposes the heart.

reaction.name: Multiple Reactions
entries: The mound can take up to three reactions per round, but no more than one per turn. If it would lose its reactions and isn’t {@condition incapacitated}, it instead loses one reaction.

reaction.name: Withdraw
entries: When an attack or spell targets or damages its exposed heart, the mound withdraws the heart into its body, protecting it from further harm until it is exposed again.

reaction.name: Lash Out
entries: When it takes melee damage, the mound lashes out with a tentacle. The attacker must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or be pushed 10 ft. away; on a failure by 5 or more, the attacker also falls {@condition prone}.

reaction.name: Roll
entries: When it takes ranged damage or a harmful spell, the mound moves up to its speed directly toward or away from the attacker (no opportunity attacks). If it moves toward the attacker, it may then attempt to shove them.

trait.name: Screams of the Dead
entries: Any creature within 10 feet of Rahadin that isn’t protected by a {@spell mind blank} spell hears in its mind the screams of the thousands he has killed.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Rahadin has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can’t put him to sleep.

trait.name: Indomitable
entries: If Rahadin fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead. If he does so, he is hindered until the end of his next turn. While hindered, he is slowed, can use one fewer reaction each round, and can’t use his Multiattack.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries: Rahadin’s innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 15}). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:
{@spell phantom steed} 3/day, {@spell nondetection} 1/day

trait.name: Mask of the Wild
entries: Rahadin can attempt to hide even when he is only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, or other natural phenomena.

trait.name: Murderous Instinct
entries: When Rahadin drops to 0 hit points, he stows his saber and draws his twin scimitars, Thorn and Chain. His statistics are then replaced by those of his second form. His initiative count doesn’t change, excess damage doesn’t carry over, and he doesn’t retain any conditions.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Rahadin makes two attacks.

action.name: Saber
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) slashing damage, and Rahadin can push the target up to 5 ft. Away. Instead of pushing, he can force the target to succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be {@condition prone}.

action.name: Poisoned Dart
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +11} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 1d4 + 6}) piercing plus 2d4 poison damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of Rahadin’s next turn.

bonus.name: Wind Strike
entries: Rahadin moves up to his speed in a straight line toward a space he can see, passing through creatures without provoking opportunity attacks. Each creature within 5 ft. of his path must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.

bonus.name: Whirling Blades
entries: Each creature within 10 ft. of Rahadin must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.

reaction.name: Multiple Reactions
entries: Rahadin can take up to three reactions per round, but no more than one per turn. If he would lose his reactions and isn’t {@condition incapacitated}, he instead loses one reaction.

reaction.name: Punishing Strike
entries: When Rahadin is hit by a melee or ranged attack, he moves up to his speed toward the attacker and makes a Saber attack. This movement doesn’t provoke opportunity attacks.

reaction.name: Disarm
entries: When an enemy misses Rahadin with a melee weapon attack, he forces that enemy to make a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw (with advantage if the enemy grips the weapon two‑handed). On a failure, the enemy drops the weapon, which lands 10 ft. away.

reaction.name: Misty Step (1/round)
entries: When an enemy misses Rahadin with an attack or deals damage to him, he casts {@spell misty step} and can immediately take the Hide action. He doesn’t need to see his destination when casting the spell in this way.

reaction.name: Psychic Scream (1/day)
entries: When Rahadin is reduced to 0 hit points, each creature within 60 ft. of him must make a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw, taking 11 ({@damage 2d10}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. A creature that fails by 5 or more is {@condition stunned} until the start of Rahadin’s next turn.

trait.name: Screams of the Dead
entries: Any creature within 10 feet of Rahadin that isn’t protected by a {@spell mind blank} spell hears in its mind the screams of the thousands of people he has killed.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Rahadin has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can’t put him to sleep.

trait.name: Indomitable
entries: If Rahadin fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead. If he does so, he is hindered until the end of his next turn. While hindered, he is slowed, can use one fewer reaction each round, and can’t use his Multiattack.

trait.name: Mask of the Wild
entries: Rahadin can attempt to hide even when he is only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, or other natural phenomena.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Rahadin makes three attacks with Thorn and/or Chain, and can replace one attack with Haunt.

action.name: Thorn
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d6 + 6}) slashing damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or bleed for 1 minute. A bleeding creature repeats the save at the start of each of its turns, taking {@damage 1d6} slashing damage on a failure. The bleeding ends early on a successful save or if the creature receives magical healing.

action.name: Chain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d6 + 6}) slashing damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or have its speed reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn. If it fails by 5 or more, it also falls {@condition prone}.

action.name: Haunt
entries: Rahadin targets one creature he can see within 30 ft. The target must make a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage and become {@condition frightened} and {@condition deafened} by shrieking souls until the start of Rahadin’s next turn.

bonus.name: Deathly Choir
entries: Each creature within 10 ft. of Rahadin that isn’t protected by a {@spell mind blank} spell must make a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw, taking 9 ({@damage 2d8}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. A creature that fails by 5 or more is also {@condition frightened} until the start of Rahadin’s next turn.

bonus.name: Swift Step
entries: Rahadin takes the Dash or Disengage action.

reaction.name: Multiple Reactions
entries: Rahadin can take up to three reactions per round, but no more than one per turn. If he would lose his reactions and isn’t {@condition incapacitated}, he instead loses one reaction.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: Rahadin adds +5 to his AC against one attack that would hit him, to the result of a failed Dexterity saving throw, or nullifies {@spell magic missile}. If he causes a melee attack to miss, he may immediately spend another available reaction to use Riposte.

reaction.name: Riposte
entries: When an enemy misses Rahadin with a melee attack, he moves up to his speed to a space within 5 ft. of the attacker (no opportunity attacks) and makes a Thorn or Chain attack against that creature with advantage.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: Muriel regains 10 hit points at the start of her turn if she hasn't taken necrotic damage or bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage from a silvered weapon since her last turn.

trait.name: Mimic
entries: Muriel can mimic simple sounds she has heard, such as a whisper, a baby's cry, or animal noises. A creature that hears the sounds can discern they are imitations with a successful {@dc 10} Wisdom (Insight) check.

trait.name: Plummet
entries: If Muriel flies at least 20 ft. straight toward a target while descending at least 5 ft. and then hits that target with a Shortsword attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage and must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Muriel makes two weapon attacks, one of which can be with her Hand Crossbow.

action.name: Shortsword (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hand Crossbow (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +5} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Beak (Raven or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 piercing damage in raven form, or 5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage in hybrid form. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or be cursed with wereraven lycanthropy.

bonus.name: Shapechange
entries: Muriel magically polymorphs into a raven‑humanoid hybrid or a raven, or back into her human form. Her statistics other than size are the same in each form, and equipment doesn't transform. She reverts to human form if she dies.

reaction.name: Interpose
entries: When a creature Muriel can see hits another target within 5 ft. of her, she can take the damage instead.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The werewolf has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Uncanny Speed
entries: The werewolf has a walking speed of 40 ft. in wolf form.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The werewolf has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the werewolf's allies is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The werewolf regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If it takes necrotic damage or bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage from a silvered weapon, this trait doesn’t function at the start of its next turn. The werewolf dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn’t regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The werewolf makes two attacks: two with its Spear (humanoid form) or one with its Bite and one with its Claws (wolf or hybrid form).

action.name: Bite (Wolf or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage. Instead of dealing damage, the werewolf can grapple the target (escape {@dc 11}). If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be cursed with werewolf lycanthropy.

action.name: Claws (Wolf or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) slashing damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be {@condition prone}.

action.name: Spear (Humanoid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage, or 6 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) if wielded two‑handed in melee.

bonus.name: Shapechange
entries: The werewolf polymorphs into a wolf‑humanoid hybrid or a wolf, or back into its true form (humanoid). Its statistics other than AC are the same in each form. Equipment melds into the new form. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

monster.name: Izek Strazni

trait.name: Second Phase
entries: When Izek is reduced to 0 hit points, his arms and axe are engulfed in flames, the barbs on his fiendish arm grow longer and sharper, and his skin grows red and begins to smoke. His statistics are then instantly replaced by the statistics of his second form. His initiative count doesn’t change. Excess damage doesn't carry over to his new form, but he retains any conditions he had in his previous form.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Izek makes two attacks.

action.name: Silvered Battleaxe
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) slashing damage and Izek can push the target up to 5 ft. away.

action.name: Flame Hurl
entries: Ranged spell attack: {@hit 5} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

bonus.name: Slicing Whirl
entries: Izek whirls his battleaxe around him. Each creature within a 5-foot radius must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take 5 ({@damage 2d4}) slashing damage and fall {@condition prone}. A creature that succeeds on the saving throw takes half damage and doesn’t fall {@condition prone}

bonus.name: Flame Volley
entries: Izek conjures a volley of fiery orbs that rain down on a point within 60 ft. that he can see. Each creature within 10 ft. of that point must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

reactionHeader: Izek can take up to three reactions per round, but only one per turn. If Izek would lose his reactions and isn't incapacitated, he loses one reaction instead.

reaction.name: Indomitable. Trigger
entries: A hostile creature ends its turn. Effect: Izek can repeat the saving throw against one effect or condition currently affecting it. (This reaction has no effect if the effect or condition didn’t originally require it to fail a saving throw.)

reaction.name: Forceful Retreat
entries: In response to taking damage from a melee attack, Izek makes a shove attack against the attacker. He can then immediately move up to 15 ft. away from the attacker without provoking opportunity attacks.

reaction.name: Vengeful Strike
entries: In response to taking damage from an attack or spell, Izek can move up to 15 ft. toward the attacker without provoking opportunity attacks. He can then immediately make an attack against that creature with his battleaxe.

monster.name: Champion of Seriach

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Izek makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Silvered Battleaxe
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) slashing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) fire damage

action.name: Burning Punch
entries: Melee weapon attack: {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) fire damage, and Izek can push the target up to 5 ft. away. On a critical hit, the target must also succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition dazed|FleeMortals} until the start of Izek’s next turn. (That creature can move or take one action on its turn, not both. It also can’t take a bonus action or a reaction.)

action.name: Flaming Wave
entries: A wave of flames sweeps out from Izek in a line that is 60 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in the line must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or take 11 ({@damage 2d10}) fire damage. The fire ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried

bonus.name: Flame Burst
entries: Izek slams his battleaxe into the ground, causing a torrent of flames to swirl around him. Each creature within 5 feet must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage

bonus.name: Explosive Blast
entries: A bright streak flashes from Izek’s clawed hand to a point he chooses within 90 feet and then blossoms with a low roar into an explosion of flame. Each creature in a 5-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A target that fails the save is also knocked {@condition prone}. The fire spreads around corners. It ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried

reactionHeader: Izek can take up to three reactions per round, but only one per turn. If Izek would lose his reactions and isn't incapacitated, he loses one reaction instead.

reaction.name: Indomitable. Trigger
entries: A hostile creature ends its turn. Effect: Izek can repeat the saving throw against one effect or condition currently affecting it. (This reaction has no effect if the effect or condition didn’t originally require it to fail a saving throw.)

reaction.name: Hot Pursuit
entries: In response to taking damage from an attack or spell, Izek propels himself forward with a jet of crackling flames, moving up to 30 feet without provoking opportunity attacks. He can then immediately make a burning punch attack against a creature within range.

reaction.name: Cinder Sparks
entries: In response to taking damage from a melee attack, Izek causes the air around him to burst with swirling cinders. The attacker must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or take 2 ({@damage 1d4}) fire damage and be {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.

reaction.name: Retaliatory Burn (1/round)
entries: In response to taking damage from a melee attack made with a metal weapon, Izek causes the object to glow red-hot until the start of his next turn. Any creature in physical contact with the weapon immediately takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage and must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or drop the weapon if it can. If it doesn’t drop the object, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the start of Izek’s next turn
